Exaggerate: The claim does not appear to exaggerate the mistake made by Joe Biden in referring to the locations of the massacres. It simply states the incorrect locations he mentioned.
Understate: The claim does not understate the mistake made by Joe Biden. It accurately describes his incorrect statements.
Falters at times: The claim does not provide any evidence of Joe Biden faltering at times. It only focuses on the specific mistake he made in referring to the locations of the massacres.
Lack enough support: The claim is supported by the testimony of reporter Lyndsay Winkley, who personally heard Biden make the mistake and corrected himself later. It also mentions that readers asked Snopes to verify the incident, which they rated as "true."
Problematic assumption: The claim does not make any problematic assumptions. It simply states the factual error made by Joe Biden.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations for Biden's mistake. It only focuses on the incorrect locations he mentioned.
Contradict fact: The claim accurately states that Joe Biden incorrectly referred to the locations of the massacres in El Paso and Dayton. It does not contradict any facts.
